channel.title: Signal Routing Question
channel.description:
Hi all,
I'm planning to use an headphone amplifier as a "mixer" to route one single stereo input signal to my four axoloti, is there any side effect related to impedance or other stuff doing this way?
I'd like to use something like this https://www.thomann.de/it/millenium_ha4.htm
so the routing would be Stereo input -> HA4 input HA4 in1 -> axo1 HA4 in2 -> axo2 HA4 in3 -> axo3 HA4 in4 -> axo4

item.title: Signal Routing Question
item.dc:creator: @TheSlowGrowth
item.description:
@TheSlowGrowth wrote:

It should be fine like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Signal Routing Question
item.dc:creator: @AdrianWillaert
item.description:
@AdrianWillaert wrote:

Hi all,

I'm planning to use an headphone amplifier as a "mixer" to route one single stereo input signal to my four axoloti,
is there any side effect related to impedance or other stuff doing this way?

I'd like to use something like this

www.thomann.de

Millenium HA 4

Stereo headphone amplifier 4-Channel, Separate volume control for each channel, 1 Input with 6,3 mm stereo jack, 4 outputs with 6,3 mm stereo jack, Includes 12 V power supply, Dimensions (W x H x D): 129 x 30 x 83 mm

so the routing would be
Stereo input -> HA4 input
HA4 in1 -> axo1
HA4 in2 -> axo2
HA4 in3 -> axo3
HA4 in4 -> axo4

Read full topic
